revised_title: Model-Independent Aspects of Perturbation Chromatography Theory
tldr: The article presents a model-independent approach to perturbation chromatography theory, focusing on the relationship between equilibrium properties and mean response times for step and pulse perturbations. The authors demonstrate that mean times for the response of a chromatographic column are independent of mass transfer processes and can be determined from measurements of the response. This approach extends the model-independent treatment to multicomponent chromatography, providing a more complex but versatile method for determining phase-equilibrium properties.
